intro: Galium verum var. intermedium, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming from June to August. Its flowers are followed by small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Galium verum var. intermedium thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
